info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 20 at 8:41PM EDT until August 20 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Monroe County in east central Ohio... Western Belmont County in east central Ohio... Northern Noble County in east central Ohio... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 841 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Concord, or 7 miles southwest of Cambridge, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Barnesville, Byesville, Bethesda, Antrim, Flushing, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Holloway, and Lore City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
